intro: Erigeron annuus subsp. annuus, commonly known as common fleabane, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features a hairy stem with alternate, heart-shaped to lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in a variety of habitats, including roadsides, fields, and disturbed soils. Common fleabane is often used in wildflower gardens and is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
